instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2850: What is 820-2850? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: 2010 15" white/black screen
threads.message: Computer starts with logo but eventually screen goes white or black (depending on it being warm or not). Is it worth trying to reflow the mux (and tant cap) or is this likely a GPU problem? All help is welcome :)

threads.title: 2010 15" white/black screen
threads.message: First replace <CAPACITOR>C9650</CAPACITOR> and only if this a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>. This is no MUX issue for sure.

threads.title: 2010 15" white/black screen
threads.message: Thanks. Turn out it's a 2011 model after all :mad:

threads.title: 2010 15" white/black screen
threads.message: That is easy, just replace the GPU.

threads.title: 2010 15" white/black screen
threads.message: Yes, that would be easy with a BGA rework station :) Thanks anyway!

threads.title: 2010 15" white/black screen
threads.message: I could refer the client your way. What's your company name and how can they reach you?

threads.title: 2010 15" white/black screen
threads.message: If you're interested, send your contact details in PM. You have my word I won't bother you through your company contact :)
